settings.question: How is Slugg® different to the rest?
settings.answer: Sluggs® are sold in sets of three. A small, medium, and large size. This makes it easy to create your perfect three pot cluster. The dimensions of each pot have been carefully considered, so proportionately they make the perfect garden pot cluster.

settings.question: Are you affiliated with The Balcony Garden?
settings.answer: Yes! The Balcony Garden is our sister brand. Our products are manufactured in the same factory which means the quality and finish is exactly the same.

settings.question: Can I purchase Slugg® pots individually?
settings.answer: No, Slugg® pots are sold as a cluster of 3 in one box.

settings.question: Do you offer trade or wholesale?
settings.answer: Trade customers are welcome to purchase via the website, however we do not offer trade discounts. Slugg® is not available for wholesale.

settings.question: Do you have a physical showroom?
settings.answer: Slugg® is a 100% online business. Without the need for expensive showrooms and retail spaces, we’re able to keep the prices down.

settings.question: Are Slugg® pots handmade?
settings.answer: Yes, all of our pots are handmade using moulds. Slugg pots are finished and painted by hand too.

settings.question: What are they made out of?
settings.answer:
Our pots are made of poly-resin making them extremely strong, waterproof and lightweight. Slugg® pots can be used indoors and outdoors.

Polyresin is a synthetic polymer material that is commonly used to create decorative objects and sculptures. It is a mixture of resin and hardening agents that is molded into shape and then cured to form a solid, durable material. Polyresin is prized for its versatility, as it can be molded into a wide variety of shapes.

settings.question: Are they waterproof?
settings.answer: Yes, Slugg® pots are waterproof as long as you’ve planted your pots as per our instructions.

settings.question: Do they have drainage holes?
settings.answer: Yes, each pot comes with 2 x 30mm drainage holes. This ensures that as long as you followed our planted guide, your plants will never sit in wet feet.

settings.question: Do you offer payment options?
settings.answer: Yes! We have several trusted payment options including Afterpay, Apple Pay and PayPal.

settings.question: Do Slugg® pots come with pot feet and drainage screen?
settings.answer: Pot feet or drainage screen is not included. However, you can add drainage kits for $10 to your order.

settings.question: Which Slugg® am I?
settings.answer: If you weren't happy with the Myers-Briggs Test, we've got good news for you. Take the Which Slugg® Am I? quiz to learn who you truly are.

settings.question: Can I buy a Slugg eGift card?
settings.answer: Yes, you sure can! You can purchase here

settings.question: Do you offer free shipping?
settings.answer:
We provide free delivery (over $50) to metro areas. We charge $19 to areas classified as  Zone 2. We charge $99 to areas classified as Zone 3. At this stage, we cannot send Sluggs to NT or TAS. 

Due to the increased cost of shipping due to fuel levies, we cannot send to non-metro areas in QLD and WA, however, please email info@slugg.com.au, and we will provide you with a quote. As a rough guide, rural shipping costs between $59 - $149 per set depending on location.

settings.question: Can I track my order via the Shop App?
settings.answer: Please note that due to the fragile nature of Slugg® pots, we DO NOT use Auspost to send your order. Your order will be sent using Airroad or Capital Transport. Please use the tracking number and link sent to you via email to track your order.

settings.question: Why do you charge for delivery outside of metro?
settings.answer: We go to great lengths to ensure your Sluggs® don't arrive broken. Delivering to areas outside of metro requires that we send your order on a small pallet to ensure your Sluggs® don't break in transit. Unfortunately, this increases the delivery cost threefold.

settings.question: Do you offer return & refunds
settings.answer: We Do NOT offer refunds or exchanges for change of mind.

settings.question: What happens if my Sluggs® arrive damaged?
settings.answer: We’ve 100% got your back. If your pots arrive damaged, simply get in touch with us (within 24 hours) and we’ll either refund you or send you another set. Simply send an email to support@slugg.com.au. Make sure you get in contact within 24 hours or your request may be refused. For more info please refer to our T&C's.

settings.question: How are Sluggs® packaged?
settings.answer: Your Slugg® pot cluster will arrive in a single cardboard box which is 50cm x 50xm x 60cm H. If your order is being sent to Zones 2 or 3, your order may arrive on a timber pallet. It is the custmers responsibility to remove the pallet from site.

settings.question: Why is my postcode is in the wrong shipping zone?
settings.answer: Slugg® uses a 3rd party transport provider who is responsible for assigning which postcodes fall within each zone. We are, therefore, unable to reassign your postcode to a different zone. We apologise if you feel your postcode has been incorrectly allocated; however, it is outside our control.

settings.question: Will I receive tracking information for my order?
settings.answer: Yes! Metro locations will receive a text message confirming a suitable delivery time followed by updates as your order progresses. Orders outside of metro areas will receive a tracking number from our transport provider. Please be aware that what constitutes metro and non-metro is decided by our delivery partners, so you may receive either a text or simply a tracking number.

settings.question: How do I pot up my Sluggs®?
settings.answer: Check out our handy potting guide here

settings.question: Can they be used indoors & outside?
settings.answer: Yes, Slugg® garden pots are suitable for use outdoors in rain, hail, sun or snow. They also look great indoors.

settings.question: How do I stop water leaking out the base?
settings.answer: You can add a set of three pot trays to go inside your pots for $20.

settings.question: What plants should I use?
settings.answer: Check out some of the suggestions in our plant guide.

settings.title: Need more help?
settings.text: We're here to help you create the perfect garden pot cluster for your home!

settings.title: Plant Guide
settings.text: Looking for advice on plants? Try our plant guide featuring some of the best plants for garden pots.

settings.title: Got it, let's shop
settings.text: Let's go find your perfect garden pot cluster! Three colours available in three unqiue styles.
